title: Manchin Rejected Biden Bill Over Inflation, Debt Concerns. How Founded Are Those Worries?
sub_head: Economists see mostly small effects on prices and federal deficits from president’s proposed spending plan
body:
Elevated inflation is posing a stumbling block for Democrats as they seek to pass President Biden’s roughly $2 trillion social- and climate-spending package, prompting renewed questions about the extent to which the proposal would exacerbate the sharp increase in consumer prices.
The Biden administration has framed the social-spending package, dubbed Build Back Better, as one that would help lower costs for families over time. Some Republicans say more government spending could fuel additional price increases.
